18.verse: The tent pegs of the Mishkan, and the tent pegs of the khatzer, and their cords,

19.verse: The Bigdei HaSerad leSharet baKodesh (to do service in HaKodesh), the Bigdei HaKodesh for Aharon the kohen, and the garments of his banim, to minister in the kohen’s office.

20.verse: And all the Adat Bnei Yisroel departed from the presence of Moshe.

21.verse: And they came, every one whose lev moved him, and every one of nedevah ruach of him, and they brought terumat Hashem to the work of the Ohel Mo’ed, and for kol avodat of it, and for the Bigdei HaKodesh.

22.verse: And they came, both anashim and nashim, as many as were nediv lev, and brought bracelets, and face-adornment rings, and rings, and body ornaments, all jewelry of zahav; and every ish that offered offered a tenufat zahav unto Hashem.

23.verse: And kol ish, with whom was found turquoise, and purple, and scarlet wool, and fine linen, and goat hair, and dyed red rams skin, and tachash skins, brought them.

24.verse: Every one that did offer a terumat kesef and nechoshet brought the terumat Hashem; and found acacia wood for any melachet haAvodah, brought it.

25.verse: And every isha that was chachmat lev spun with her hands, and brought the spun yarn, both of turquoise, and of purple, and of scarlet, and of fine linen.

26.verse: And all the nashim whose lev stirred them up in chochmah spun goat hair.

27.verse: And the nesi’im brought shoham stones, and gemstones to be set, for the Ephod, and for the Choshen;

28.verse: And spice, and shemen for the light, and for the shemen hamishchah, and for the ketoret spices.

29.verse: The Bnei Yisroel brought a nedavah unto Hashem, kol ish and isha, with nadav lev of them brought for kol hamelachah, which Hashem had commanded to be done through Moshe.

30.verse: And Moshe said unto the Bnei Yisroel, See, Hashem hath called by shem Bezalel ben Uri, ben Chur, of the tribe of Yehudah;

31.verse: And He hath filled him with the Ruach Elohim [Ac 2:4], in chochmah, in understanding, and in da’as, and in all manner of workmanship;

32.verse: And to make machashavot (artistic works), to work in zahav, and in kesef, and in nechoshet,

33.verse: And in the cutting of gems, to set them, and in wood carving, to make every melachat machashavet (work of art).

34.verse: And He hath given him the ability to teach, both he, and Oholiav ben Achisamach, of the tribe of Dan.

35.verse: Them hath He filled with chochmat lev, to do all manner of artistic work, of the carver, and of the weaver of artistic design work, and of the embroiderer, in turquoise, and in purple, in scarlet wool, and in fine linen, and of the weaver, even of them that do artistic work, and of those that make artistic designs.

1.verse: Then Bezalel and Oholiav, and kol ish chacham lev, in whom Hashem gave chochmah and tevunah to have da’as to do all manner of work for the Avodas HaKodesh, according to all that Hashem had commanded.

2.verse: And Moshe called Bezalel and Oholiav, and kol ish chochmah lev, in whose lev Hashem had given chochmah, even every one whose lev stirred him up to come unto the work to do it;

3.verse: And they received of Moshe kol haterumah, which the Bnei Yisroel had brought for the work of the Avodas HaKodesh, to make it withal. And they brought yet unto him nedavah every boker.

4.verse: And all the chachamim, that wrought all the work of HaKodesh, came every man from his work which they were doing;

5.verse: And they spoke unto Moshe, saying, HaAm bring much more than enough for the Avodah of the work, which Hashem commanded to do.

6.verse: And Moshe gave commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the machaneh, saying, Let neither ish nor isha make any more work for the terumat HaKodesh. So HaAm were restrained from bringing.

7.verse: For the work had been sufficient for all the work to do it v’hoter.

8.verse: And kol chacham lev among them that wrought the work of the Mishkan made ten curtains of fine linen, twisted with turquoise, and purple, and scarlet wool; with keruvim in a woven artistic design made he [Bezalel] them.

9.verse: The length of each curtain was twenty and eight cubits, and the width of each curtain four cubits; the curtains were all of the one size.

10.verse: And he joined five curtains one unto another; and the other five curtains he joined one unto another.

11.verse: And he made loops of turquoise wool on the edge of one curtain at the end of the first set; likewise he made them along the edge of the end curtains of the second set.

12.verse: Fifty loops made he in one curtain, and fifty loops made he in the end curtain in the second set; the loops were to be opposite one another.

13.verse: And he made fifty hooks of zahav, and joined the curtains one unto another with the hooks; so it became Mishkan Echad.

14.verse: And he made curtains of goat hair for the Ohel over the Mishkan; eleven curtains he made them.

15.verse: The length of one curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits was the width of one curtain; the eleven curtains were of the one size.

16.verse: And he joined five curtains into a set, and six curtains into a set.

17.verse: And he made fifty loops upon the uttermost edge of the curtain at the end of the set, and fifty loops made he upon the edge of the curtain of the other set.

18.verse: And he made fifty hooks of nechoshet to attach the Ohel together, that it might be echad (one).

19.verse: And he made a Mikhseh (Cover) for the Ohel of dyed red ram skin, and a tachash hide Mikhseh above that.

20.verse: And he made kerashim (planks) for the Mishkan of acacia wood, standing erect.

21.verse: The length of a keresh (plank) was ten cubits, and the width of a keresh one cubit and a half.

22.verse: One keresh had two yadot (projections, tenons), equally distant one from another; thus did he make for all the kerashim of the Mishkan.

23.verse: And he made kerashim (frames) for the Mishkan; twenty kerashim for the negev (south) side southward;

24.verse: And arba’im sockets of kesef he made under the twenty kerashim; two sockets under one keresh for its two tenons, and two sockets under another keresh for its two tenons.

25.verse: And for the other side of the Mishkan, which is toward the north, he made twenty kerashim,

26.verse: And their arba’im sockets of kesef; two sockets under one keresh, and two sockets under another keresh.

27.verse: And for the sides of the Mishkan westward he made six kerashim.

28.verse: And two kerashim made he for the corners of the Mishkan in the back.

29.verse: And they were doubled at the bottom, and joined together; at the top thereof, there was one ring; thus he did to both of them in both the corners.

30.verse: And there were eight kerashim; and their sockets were sixteen sockets of kesef, under every keresh two sockets.

31.verse: And he made crossbars of acacia wood; five for the kerashim of the one side of the Mishkan,

32.verse: And five crossbars for the kerashim of the other side of the Mishkan, and five crossbars for the kerashim of the Mishkan for the sides westward.

33.verse: And he made the middle crossbar to extend within the kerashim from the one end to the other.

34.verse: And he overlaid the kerashim with zahav, and made their rings of zahav to be housing for the crossbars, and overlaid the crossbars with zahav.

35.verse: And he made a Parochet [see Mk 15:38] of turquoise, and purple, and scarlet wool, and twisted fine linen; with keruvim made he it of artistic embroidery.

36.verse: And he made thereunto four ammudim of acacia wood, and overlaid them with zahav; their hooks were of zahav; and he cast for them four sockets of kesef.

37.verse: And he made a Masach for the petach of the Ohel of turquoise, and purple, and scarlet wool, and twisted fine linen, the work of artistic embroidery;

38.verse: And the five ammudim of it with their hooks; and he overlaid their tops and their bands with zahav; but their five sockets were of nechoshet.

1.verse: And Bezalel made the Aron of acacia wood; two cubits and a half was the length of it, and a cubit and a half the width of it, and a cubit and a half the height of it;

2.verse: And he overlaid it with zahav tahor within and without, and made a crown of zahav all around.

3.verse: And he cast for it four rings of zahav, to be set by the four corners of it; even two rings upon the one side of it, and two rings upon the other side of it.

4.verse: And he made carrying poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with zahav.

5.verse: And he put the carrying poles into the rings on the sides of the Aron, to bear the Aron.

6.verse: And he made the Kapporet of zahav tahor; two cubits and a half was the length thereof, and one cubit and a half the width thereof.

7.verse: And he made two keruvim of zahav, hammered out of one piece made he them, on the two ends of the Kapporet;

8.verse: One keruv on the end on this side, and another keruv on the other end on that side; from the Kapporet made he the keruvim on the two ends thereof.

9.verse: And the keruvim spread out their wings on high, and covered with their wings over the Kapporet, with their faces one to another; even toward the Kapporet were the faces of the keruvim.

10.verse: And he made the Shulchan of acacia wood: two cubits was the length thereof, and a cubit the width thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof;

11.verse: And he overlaid it with zahav tahor, and made thereunto a crown of zahav all around.

12.verse: Also he made thereunto a misgeret (moulding, rim) of a handbreadth all around; and made a crown of zahav for the misgeret thereof all around.

13.verse: And he cast for it four rings of zahav, and put the rings upon the four corners of its four legs thereof.

14.verse: Over against the misgeret were the rings, the housing for the carrying poles to bear the Shulchan.

15.verse: And he made the carrying poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with zahav, to bear the Shulchan.

16.verse: And he made the utensils which were upon the Shulchan, its dishes, and its pans, and its bowls, and its pitchers for pouring nesekh, of zahav tahor.

17.verse: And he made the Menorah of zahav tahor; of hammered-out work made he the Menorah; its base and its shaft, and its cups, its knobs, its flowers, were of the same;

18.verse: And six branches going out of the sides thereof; three branches of the Menorah out of the one side thereof, and three branches of the Menorah out of the other side thereof;

19.verse: Shloshah cups made like almonds in one branch, a knob and a flower; and three cups made like almonds in another branch, a knob and a flower; so throughout the six branches going out of the Menorah.

20.verse: And in the Menorah were four cups made like almonds, its knobs, and its flowers;

21.verse: And a knob under two branches of the same, and a knob under two branches of the same, and a knob under two branches of the same, according to the six branches going out of it.

22.verse: Their knobs and their branches were of the same: all of it was one hammered-out work of zahav tahor.

23.verse: And he made its seven nerot (lamps), and its tongs, and its spoons, of zahav tahor.

24.verse: Of a talent of zahav tahor made he it, and all the utensils thereof.

25.verse: And he made the Mizbe’ach HaKetoret of acacia wood; the length of it was a cubit, and the width of it a cubit; it was ravu’a (square, foursquare); and two cubits was the height of it; from it were its karenot.

26.verse: And he overlaid it with zahav tahor, both the top of it, and the sides thereof all around, and the karenot of it; also he made unto it a crown of zahav all around.

27.verse: And he made two rings of zahav for it under the crown thereof, by the two corners of it, upon the two sides thereof, to be housing for the carrying poles to bear it withal.

28.verse: And he made the carrying poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with zahav.

29.verse: And he made the Shemen HaMishchah Kodesh, and the ketoret spices, tahor, according to the artistic work of a perfumer.

1.verse: [PEKUDEI] - And he made the Mizbe’ach HaOlah of acacia wood; five cubits was the length thereof, and five cubits the width thereof; it was ravu’a (square, foursquare); and three cubits the height thereof.

2.verse: And he made the karenot thereof on the four corners of it; the karenot thereof were from it; and he overlaid it with nechoshet.

3.verse: And he made all the Klei HaMizbe’ach, the pots, and the shovels, and the sprinkling basins, and the meat hooks, and the firepans; all the utensils thereof made he of nechoshet.

4.verse: And he made for the Mizbe’ach a mikhbar (grate, netting), a meshwork of nechoshet under the encompassing border thereof downward unto the middle of it.

5.verse: And he cast four rings for the four ends of the mikhbar of nechoshet, to be housing for the carrying poles.

6.verse: And he made the carrying poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with nechoshet.

7.verse: And he put the carrying poles into the rings on the sides of the Mizbe’ach, to bear it withal; he made the Mizbe’ach hollow with luchot.

8.verse: And he made the Kiyor of nechoshet, and the stand of it of nechoshet, of the mirrors of the tzve’ot, who assembled at the petach Ohel Mo’ed.

9.verse: And he made the khatzer; on the south side southward the hangings of the khatzer were of twisted fine linen, a hundred cubits;

10.verse: Their ammudim were twenty, and their sockets of nechoshet twenty; the hooks of the ammudim and their bands were of kesef.

11.verse: And for the north side the hangings were a hundred cubits, their ammudim were twenty, and their sockets of nechoshet twenty; the hooks of the ammudim and their bands of kesef.

12.verse: And for the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their ammudim ten, and their sockets ten; the hooks of the ammudim and their bands of kesef.

13.verse: And for the east side eastward fifty cubits.

14.verse: The hangings of the one side of the entrance were fifteen cubits; their ammudim shloshah, and their sockets shloshah.

15.verse: And for the other side. On each side of the khatzer, were hangings of fifteen cubits; their ammudim shloshah, and their sockets shloshah.

16.verse: All the hangings of the khatzer all around were of twisted fine linen.

17.verse: And the sockets for the ammudim were of nechoshet; the hooks of the ammudim and their bands of kesef; and the overlaying of their tops of kesef; and all the ammudim of the khatzer were banded with kesef.

18.verse: And the masach for the sha’ar of the khatzer was the artistic work of an embroiderer, of turquoise, and purple, and scarlet wool, and twisted fine linen; and twenty cubits was the length, and the height in width was five cubits, corresponding to the hangings of the khatzer.

19.verse: And their ammudim were four, and their sockets of nechoshet four; their hooks of kesef, and the overlaying of their tops and their bands of kesef.

20.verse: And all the tent pegs of the Mishkan, and of the khatzer all around, were of nechoshet.

21.verse: These are the pekudei Mishkan, even of the Mishkan HaEdut, as it was recorded, according to the command of Moshe, for the Avodat HaLevi’im, by the yad of Itamar ben Aharon the kohen.

22.verse: And Bezalel ben Uri ben Chur, of the tribe of Yehudah, made all that Hashem commanded Moshe.

23.verse: And with him was Oholiav ben Achisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an artistic carver, weaver, and an embroiderer in turquoise, and in purple, and in scarlet wool, and fine linen.

24.verse: All the zahav that was occupied for the work in all the work of HaKodesh, even the zahav of the tenufah, was twenty and nine talents, and seven hundred and thirty shekels, after the shekel of HaKodesh.

25.verse: And the kesef of them that were numbered of HaEdah was a hundred talents, and a thousand seven hundred and threescore and fifteen shekels, after the shekel of HaKodesh:

26.verse: A bekah for every man, that is, half a shekel, after the shekel of HaKodesh, for every one that went to be numbered, from twenty years old and upward, for six hundred thousand and three thousand and five hundred and fifty men.

27.verse: And of the hundred talents of kesef were cast the sockets of HaKadosh, and the sockets of the Parochet; a hundred sockets of the hundred talents, a talent for a socket.

28.verse: And of the thousand seven hundred seventy and five shekels he made hooks for the ammudim, and overlaid their tops, and made bands for them.

29.verse: And the nechoshet of the tenufah was seventy talents, and two thousand and four hundred shekels.

30.verse: And therewith he made the sockets to the petach Ohel Mo’ed, and the Mizbe’ach HaNechoshet, and the mikhbar hanechoshet for it, and all the Klei HaMizbe’ach,

31.verse: And the sockets of the khatzer all around, and the sockets of the khatzer sha’ar, and all the tent pegs of the Mishkan, and all the tent pegs of the khatzer all around.

1.verse: And from the turquoise, and purple, and scarlet wool, they made bigdei serad (elaborately woven garments) for service in HaKadosh, and made Bigdei Hakodesh for Aharon; as Hashem commanded Moshe.

2.verse: And he [Bezalel] made the Ephod of zahav, turquoise, and purple, and scarlet wool, and twisted fine linen.

3.verse: And they did hammer the zahav into thin sheets, and cut threads, to work into the turquoise, and into the purple, and into the fine linen, the artistic weaver’s work.

4.verse: They made attaching ketefot (shoulder straps) for it, which were attached to its two [upper] ends.

5.verse: And the Cheishev (Belt) of his Ephod, which is upon it, was of the same according to the work thereof; of zahav, turquoise, and purple, and scarlet wool, and twisted linen; as Hashem commanded Moshe.

6.verse: And they made the avnei shoham (onyx stones), set in settings of zahav, engraved, like chotam (signet ring) is engraved, according to the Shemot Bnei Yisroel.

7.verse: And he fastened them upon the Kitfot HaEphod, that they should be Avnei Zikaron (Memorial Stones) unto the Bnei Yisroel; as Hashem commanded Moshe.

8.verse: And he made the Choshen of artistic weaver’s work, like the workmanship of the Ephod; of zahav, turquoise, and purple, and scarlet wool, and fine twisted linen.

9.verse: It was ravu’a (square); they made the Choshen folded double; a span was the length thereof, and a span the width thereof, being doubled.

10.verse: And they set in it four rows of gemstones; the first row was an odem, a pitdah, and barekes; this was the first row.

11.verse: And the second row, a nofech, sapphire, and yahalom.

12.verse: And the third row, a leshem, shevo, and achlamah.

13.verse: And the fourth row, a tarshish, shoham, and yashfeh; they were set in zahav in their settings.

14.verse: And the gemstones were according to the Shemot Bnei Yisroel, Shteym Esreh (Twelve), according to their Shemot, like the engravings of a chotam (signet ring), every one with shmo, according to the Shnei Asar Shevet.

15.verse: And they made upon the Choshen sharsherot (chains) at the ends braided artistic work of zahav tahor.

16.verse: And they made two mishbetzot (filigrees) of zahav, and two rings of zahav; and put the two rings in the two ends of the Choshen.

17.verse: And they fastened the two ropes of zahav into the two rings on the ends of the Choshen.

18.verse: And the [other] two ends of the two ropes they fastened in the two filigree settings, and put them on the ketefot HaEphod toward its front.

19.verse: And they made two rings of zahav, and put them on the two ends of the Choshen, upon the lower border therof, on the inside toward the Ephod.

20.verse: And they made two other rings of zahav, and put them on the two kitfot HaEphod on the bottom, toward the front thereof, opposite the seam thereof, above the Cheishev HaEphod.

21.verse: And they did bind the Choshen by its rings unto the rings of the Ephod with a turquoise woolen cord, that it might be above the Cheishev HaEphod, and that the Choshen might not be loosed from the Ephod; as Hashem commanded Moshe.

22.verse: And he made the Me’il HaEphod of artistic weaver’s work, all of turquoise wool.

23.verse: And there was a head opening in the top of the Me’il, in its center, like the opening of a coat of mail, with a border all around about the head opening, that it should not be torn.

24.verse: And they made upon the hems of the Me’il pomegranates of turquoise, and purple, and scarlet wool, and twisted linen.

25.verse: And they made bells of zahav tahor, and put the bells between the pomegranates upon the hem of the Me’il, all around between the pomegranates;

26.verse: A bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, all around the hem of the Me’il to minister in; as Hashem commanded Moshe.

27.verse: And they made the kuttanot (tunics) of fine linen of artistic weaver’s work for Aharon, and for his banim,

28.verse: And a Mitznefet of fine linen, Pa’arei HaMigba’ot of fine linen, mikhnesei bahd,

29.verse: And an Avnet of fine linen, and turquoise, and purple, and scarlet wool, of artistic embroidery; as Hashem commanded Moshe.

30.verse: And they made the Tzitz Nezer HaKodesh of zahav tahor, and engraved upon it an inscription, like to the engravings of a chotam, KODESH LAHASHEM.

31.verse: And they tied unto it a turquoise cord, to fasten it on the Mitznefet above; as Hashem commanded Moshe.

32.verse: Thus was all the work of the Mishkan of the Ohel Mo’ed finished; and the Bnei Yisroel did according to all that Hashem commanded Moshe, so did they.

33.verse: And they brought the Mishkan unto Moshe, the Ohel, and all its utensils, its hooks, its kerashim, its crossbars, and its ammudim, and its sockets,

34.verse: And the Mikhseh of reddyed ram skins, and the Mikhseh of tachash skins, and the Parochet HaMasach,

35.verse: The Aron HaEdut, and the carrying poles thereof, and the Kapporet,

36.verse: The Shulchan, and all the utensils thereof, and the Lechem HaPanim,

37.verse: The Menorah Hatehorah, with the nerot (lamps) thereof, even with the nerot (lamps) of the order prescribed, and all the utensils thereof, and the Shemen HaMaohr,

38.verse: And the Mizbe’ach Hazahav, and the Shemen HaMishchah, and the aromatic ketoret, and the Masach petach HaOhel,

39.verse: The Mizbe’ach Hanechoshet, and its mikhbar hanechoshet (grate, netting of copper), its carrying poles, and all its utensils, the Kiyor and its Stand,

40.verse: The curtains of the khatzer (courtyard), its ammudim, and its sockets, and the masach Sha’ar HaKhatzer, its cords, and its tent pegs, and all the utensils of the Avodas HaMishkan, for the Ohel Mo’ed,

41.verse: The bigdei serad for service in HaKadosh, and the Bigdei Hakodesh for Aharon the kohen, and the garments of his banim, to minister in the kohen’s office.

42.verse: According to all that Hashem commanded Moshe, so the Bnei Yisroel did kol haAvodah.

43.verse: And Moshe did inspect all the work, and, hinei, they had done it as Hashem had commanded, even so had they done it; vayevarech otam Moshe (and Moshe blessed them).

1.verse: And Hashem spoke unto Moshe, saying,

2.verse: On the first day of the first month shalt thou set up the Mishkan Ohel Mo’ed.

3.verse: And thou shalt place therein the Aron HaEdut, and thou shalt cover so as to screen the Aron with the Parochet.

4.verse: And thou shalt bring in the Shulchan, and set in order the things that are to be set in order upon it; and thou shalt bring in the Menorah, and kindle the Nerot thereof.

5.verse: And thou shalt place the Mizbe’ach Hazahav L’Ketoret before the Aron HaEdut, and set up the Masach HaPetach LaMishkan.

6.verse: And thou shalt set the Mizbe’ach HaOlah before the Petach Mishkan Ohel Mo’ed.

7.verse: And thou shalt set the Kiyor between the Ohel Mo’ed and the Mizbe’ach, and shalt place mayim therein.

8.verse: And thou shalt set up the khatzer (court) all around, and hang up the Masach Sha’ar Hakhatzer.

9.verse: And thou shalt take the Shemen HaMishchah, and anoint the Mishkan, and all that is therein, and shalt set it apart as kodesh, and all the utensils thereof; and it shall be kodesh.

10.verse: And thou shalt anoint the Mizbe’ach HaOlah, and all its utensils, and set apart as kodesh the Mizbe’ach: and it shall be Mizbe’ach kodesh kodashim.

11.verse: And thou shalt anoint the Kiyor and its Stand, and set it apart as kodesh.

12.verse: And thou shalt bring near Aharon and his banim unto the Petach Ohel Mo’ed, and immerse them with mayim.

13.verse: And thou shalt dress Aharon with the Bigdei Hakodesh, and anoint him, and set him apart as kodesh; that he may minister unto Me in the kohen’s office.

14.verse: And thou shalt bring near his banim, and dress them with kuttanot:

15.verse: And thou shalt anoint them, as thou didst anoint their av, that they may minister unto Me in the kohen’s office: for their anointing shall surely be for them a kehunat olam throughout their dorot.

16.verse: Thus did Moshe; according to all that Hashem commanded him, so did he.

17.verse: And it came to pass in the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, that the Mishkan was erected.

18.verse: And Moshe erected the Mishkan, and fastened its sockets, and set up the kerashim thereof, and put in the crossbars thereof, and set up its ammudim.

19.verse: And he spread the Ohel over the Mishkan, and put the Mikhseh of the Ohel on it from above; as Hashem commanded Moshe.

20.verse: And he took and placed HaEdut (The Testimony, i.e., the Stone Tablets of the Ten Commandments) into HaAron, and set the carrying poles on the Aron, and put the Kapporet upon the Aron from above;

21.verse: And he brought the Aron into the Mishkan, and set up the Parochet HaMasach, and shielded with a covering over the Aron HaEdut; as Hashem commanded Moshe.

22.verse: And he put the Shulchan in the Ohel Mo’ed, upon the north side of the Mishkan, outside the Parochet.

23.verse: And he set the Lechem in order upon it before Hashem; as Hashem had commanded Moshe.

24.verse: And he put the Menorah in the Ohel Mo’ed, opposite the Shulchan, on the south side of the Mishkan.

25.verse: And he set up the nerot (lamps) before Hashem; as Hashem commanded Moshe.

26.verse: And he put the Mizbe’ach Hazahav in the Ohel Mo’ed before the Parochet;

27.verse: And he burned ketoret spices thereon; as Hashem commanded Moshe.

28.verse: And he set up the Masach HaPetach LaMishkan (Curtain of the Entrance of the Tabernacle).

29.verse: And he put the Mizbe’ach HaOlah at the Petach Mishkan Ohel Mo’ed, and offered upon it the olah (burnt offering) and the minchah; as Hashem commanded Moshe.

30.verse: And he set the Kiyor between the Ohel Mo’ed and the Mizbe’ach, and put mayim there, to wash withal.

31.verse: And Moshe and Aharon and his banim washed their hands and their feet thereat;

32.verse: When they went into the Ohel Mo’ed, and when they came near unto the Mizbe’ach, they washed; as Hashem commanded Moshe.

33.verse: And he erected the khatzer (courtyard) all around the Mishkan and the Mizbe’ach, and set up the Masach Sha’ar HaKhatzer. So Moshe finished the work.

34.verse: Then the Anan covered the Ohel Mo’ed, and the Kavod Hashem filled the Mishkan.

35.verse: And Moshe was not able to enter into the Ohel Mo’ed, because the [Shekinah] cloud abode thereon, and the Kavod Hashem filled the Mishkan.

36.verse: And when the Anan was taken up from over the Mishkan, the Bnei Yisroel went onward in all their journeys;

37.verse: But if the Anan were not taken up, then they journeyed not till the day that it was taken up.

38.verse: For the Anan Hashem was upon the Mishkan by day, and Eish was on it by night, in the sight of all the Bais Yisroel, throughout all their journeys. T.N. The Theme of gracious, unmerited Deliverance and Salvation for an Am Kesheh Oref (Obstinate Stiffnecked People) has been presented in the Second Book of Moses.
